intro: Craspedorhachis texana var. stolonifera, commonly known as the Texas stoloniferous craspedorhachis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its stoloniferous growth habit, which allows it to spread horizontally along the ground. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
